WorkItem.Description:
From thread:
http://phpexcel.codeplex.com/Thread/View.aspx?ThreadId=53622
 
It seems that height in excel is different from height in PDF.
Look on different height of 6, 7 and 8 rows in Excel and similar height of those rows in PDF.
 
PDF
http://img17.imageshack.us/img17/2899/pdfg.jpg
 
Excel7
http://img144.imageshack.us/img144/4885/excel7.jpg
WorkItem.Summary: Problems with PDF (Writers) and cells height

Comments.Message:
Also, in that screen shot there are unexpected gaps between the rows. Some quick tests indicate that this happens in TCPDF when the inline CSS font-size does not match the current font size as set via $pdf->setFont(). Have not checked if this is known issue with TCPDF.

I recommend that we first fix this:
http://phpexcel.codeplex.com/WorkItem/View.aspx?WorkItemId=9791

There will then be fewer inline CSS styles to consider, and it should be easier to track down the problem.

Height problems fixed with work item 10088:
http://phpexcel.codeplex.com/WorkItem/View.aspx?WorkItemId=10088
